intro: Corydalis oregana, commonly known as the Oregon poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and bright orange to red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has thin, branched stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Corydalis oregana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
